alert.note: Alert for Eastern Panhandle, Crescent Lake NWR; Frenchman Basin (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 18 at 2:09AM CDT until July 18 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND INTENSE HEAT HEADING FOR PARTS OF WESTERN NEBRASKA TODAY... .Afternoon temperatures will reach 100 to 105 degrees this afternoon across the eastern Nebraska Panhandle, western Sandhills and far southwestern Nebraska. With the heat, low relative humidity and gusty southerly winds, critical fire weather conditions are likely this afternoon into the early evening hours. There is also a threat for high based, dry thunderstorms which may produce lightning and gusty erratic winds in the vicinity of thunderstorms. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND THE THREAT FOR DRY THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE EASTERN NEBRASKA PANHANDLE...WESTERN SANDHILLS AND PORTIONS OF FAR SOUTHWESTERN NEBRASKA... The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a Red Flag Warning FOR WIND...LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND DRY THUNDERSTORMS, which is in effect from noon today to 8 PM MDT this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Affected Area...In NEZ204...Fire Weather Zone 204 Eastern Panhandle/Crescent Lake NWR. In NEZ210...Fire Weather Zone 210 Frenchman Basin. * Winds...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 14 percent. * Lightning...Isolated thunderstorms capable of dry lightning may develop. * Impacts...Any fire starts will be difficult or impossible to contain.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Panhandle, Crescent Lake NWR; Frenchman Basin
